name: Topic
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic
description:
Topic

A named resource to which messages are published.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.publish "task completed"

methods.name: name
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic#name
methods.description: The name of the topic in the form of “/projects/project-identifier/topics/topic-name”.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.delete

returns.description: Returns true if the topic was deleted.

methods.name: subscribe
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic#subscribe
methods.description: Creates a new Subscription object on the current Topic.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
sub = topic.subscribe "my-topic-sub"
sub.name # => "my-topic-sub"

examples.caption: Wait 2 minutes for acknowledgement and push all to endpoint:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
sub = topic.subscribe "my-topic-sub",
                      deadline: 120,
                      endpoint: "https://example.com/push"

params.name: subscription_name
params.description:
Name of the new subscription. Must
start with a letter, and contain only letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers
([0-9], dashes (-), underscores (_), periods (.), tildes (~), plus
(+) or percent signs (%). It must be between 3 and 255 characters in
length, and it must not start with “goog”. Required.

params.name: deadline
params.description:
The maximum number of seconds after a
subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should
acknowledge the message.

params.name: retain_acked
params.description: Indicates whether to retain acknowledged messages. If true, then messages are not expunged from the subscription’s backlog, even if they are acknowledged, until they fall out of the retention_duration window. Default is false.

params.name: retention
params.description: How long to retain unacknowledged messages in the subscription’s backlog, from the moment a message is published. If retain_acked is true, then this also configures the retention of acknowledged messages, and thus configures how far back in time a #seek can be done. Cannot be more than 604,800 seconds (7 days) or less than 600 seconds (10 minutes). Default is 604,800 seconds (7 days).

params.name: endpoint
params.description:
A URL locating the endpoint to which messages
should be pushed.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"

sub = topic.subscription "my-topic-sub"
sub.name #=> "projects/my-project/subscriptions/my-topic-sub"

examples.caption: Skip the lookup against the service with skip_lookup:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"

# No API call is made to retrieve the subscription information.
sub = topic.subscription "my-topic-sub", skip_lookup: true
sub.name #=> "projects/my-project/subscriptions/my-topic-sub"

params.name: skip_lookup
params.description: Optionally create a Subscription object without verifying the subscription resource exists on the Pub/Sub service. Calls made on this object will raise errors if the service resource does not exist. Default is false.

returns.description: Returns nil if the subscription does not exist.

methods.name: subscriptions
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic#subscriptions
methods.description: Retrieves a list of subscription names for the given project.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
subscriptions = topic.subscriptions
subscriptions.each do |subscription|
  puts subscription.name
end

examples.caption: Retrieve all subscriptions: (See Subscription::List#all)
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
subscriptions = topic.subscriptions
subscriptions.all do |subscription|
  puts subscription.name
end

params.name: token
params.description: The token value returned by the last call to subscriptions; indicates that this is a continuation of a call, and that the system should return the next page of data.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of subscriptions to return.

methods.name: publish
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic#publish
methods.description: Publishes one or more messages to the topic.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
msg = topic.publish "task completed"

examples.caption: A message can be published using a File object:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
msg = topic.publish File.open("message.txt")

examples.caption: Additionally, a message can be published with attributes:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
msg = topic.publish "task completed",
                    foo: :bar,
                    this: :that

examples.caption: Multiple messages can be sent at the same time using a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
msgs = topic.publish do |t|
  t.publish "task 1 completed", foo: :bar
  t.publish "task 2 completed", foo: :baz
  t.publish "task 3 completed", foo: :bif
end

params.name: yield
params.description:
a block for publishing multiple messages in one
request

returns.description:
Returns the published message when
called without a block, or an array of messages when called with a
block.

methods.name: policy
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic#policy
methods.description: Gets the Cloud IAM access control policy for this topic.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"

policy = topic.policy

examples.caption: Update the policy by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"

topic.policy do |p|
  p.add "roles/owner", "user:owner@example.com"
end

params.name: yield
params.description:
A block for updating the policy. The latest policy
will be read from the Pub/Sub service and passed to the block. After
the block completes, the modified policy will be written to the
service.

params.name: yield.policy
params.description:
the current Cloud IAM Policy for this
topic

returns.description: the current Cloud IAM Policy for this topic

methods.name: policy=
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic#policy=
methods.description:
Updates the Cloud IAM access control policy for this topic. The policy should be read from #policy. See Google::Cloud::Pubsub::Policy for an explanation of the policy etag property and how to modify policies.

You can also update the policy by passing a block to #policy, which will call this method internally after the block completes.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"

policy = topic.policy # API call

policy.add "roles/owner", "user:owner@example.com"

topic.policy = policy # API call

params.name: new_policy
params.description:
a new or modified Cloud IAM Policy for this
topic

returns.description: the policy returned by the API update operation

methods.name: test_permissions
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic#test_permissions
methods.description: Tests the specified permissions against the Cloud IAM access control policy.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
perms = topic.test_permissions "pubsub.topics.get",
                               "pubsub.topics.publish"
perms.include? "pubsub.topics.get" #=> true
perms.include? "pubsub.topics.publish" #=> false

params.name: permissions
params.description:
The set of permissions to check access for. Permissions with wildcards (such as * or storage.*) are not allowed.

The permissions that can be checked on a topic are:

  • pubsub.topics.publish
  • pubsub.topics.attachSubscription
  • pubsub.topics.get
  • pubsub.topics.delete
  • pubsub.topics.update
  • pubsub.topics.getIamPolicy
  • pubsub.topics.setIamPolicy

methods.name: exists?
title: Google
Cloud
Pubsub
Topic#exists?
methods.description: Determines whether the topic exists in the Pub/Sub service.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/pubsub"

pubsub = Google::Cloud::Pubsub.new

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.exists? #=> true
